metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3006 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A known cache speculation vulnerability, known as Branch History Injection(BHI) or Spectre-BHB, becomes actual again for the new hw AmpereOne.Spectre-BHB is similar to Spectre v2, except that malicious code uses theshared branch history (stored in the CPU Branch History Buffer, or BHB) toinfluence mispredicted branches within the victim's hardware context. Oncethat occurs, speculation caused by the mispredicted branches can causecache allocation. This issue leads to obtaining information that should notbe accessible.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-kvm - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1004-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-oracle - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1002-starfive - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-16.16').
linux-kvm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-aws package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1004.4').
linux-ibm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1001.1').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-oracle package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-raspi package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was pending').
linux-starfive package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
